ratings.comment: Ivy is a nice lady. She offers help in any way and wants you to succeed. Participation is crucial to get a good grade. The homework was sometimes difficult but was manageable and it didn't affect your grade all that much. I would definitely recommend this class. Easy A.

This was a fun and easy class. If you want to get an A you must participate often. The grammar homework can be challenging but its only worth a small part of your grade. I would definitely recommend this class!

Ivy is spectacular. You have 3 presentations throughout the semester. The presentations are simple and straight forward. Participate in class and you'll pass. I learned so much and Ivy is so helpful at teaching you how to speak!

Ivy has been my favorite professor to have at UW! She is a lot of fun and truly wants you to improve. Even with being online, the classes were fun and the 75 minutes flew by! I'm not even fully done with my semester yet and I've already reached out to her to take more classes with her! Take a class with her, you won't regret it!
Ivy is very passionate about her work but lectures are very dry and boring. She gives practice tests, make sure you do them! There is a lot of reading required and be prepared for quizzes.

Ivy truly cares about her students! The best advice I can say is that you should read the material, talk to her outside of class when you can, and communicate openly with her! She gives you the resources to be successful, be sure to use them. She's very understanding and wants to know what is going on with her students so that she can help however!

Ivy is incredible! She makes sure students have enough materials in order to learn, including her lecture slides AND recorded lectures for those who missed class! She really knows the material and makes sure that her students do too.

Ivy is a wonderful teacher who is passionate about what she teaches. She was always very accessible outside of class--usually answering questions within a half an hour. She is clear about what will be on the exam and provides MORE THAN ENOUGH resources for the students to succeed (even taped lectures).   Favorite professor at UW!

Ivy lives and breathes the material, which is what you want out of a literature professor. Although the readings are sometimes hard to grasp, she takes weeks to discuss each piece. Lenient grader on exams and papers, and takes a whole day prior to exams to review. If you can, definitely take her for your Lit Survey instructor.

Ivy is a great professor! She has tons of enthusiasm for the class and literature. She really wants her students to succeed and reviews all the materials for the exams extensively. If you have the chance, take a Spanish class with Ivy.
Perfect!! She is the best. Enthusiastic, knowledgeable and an amazing teacher. I recommend her
I love her. She is the best teacher I have ever had!!
Her enthusiasm helps make this required class tolerable. She goes through powerpoints fast, but posts them all on learn@uw. Make sure you read the book. Otherwise, this class is pretty easy.

Boring class. Tries very hard to stimulate students but no one is TRULY interested in culture of a people who lived 3000 years ago. Attend lectures and especially discussions to obtain a good grade. Take the best notes that you can... she goes way too fast with her powerpoints.

I have nothing against Ivy, but this class blows.  The textbook is all over the place, therefore so are her lectures.  I took this class purely because I love Spanish culture and it has been one of the most useless experiences of my life.  It's easy, don't worry about it if you need it, but if it's an elective avoid it like la plaga negra.

She can be a little pretentious and boring at times, but she's a fair professor and wants you all to learn about Hispanic Culture. Because of the length of the class, it's tough to go through millennia of history at a slower pace, but she does a good job at making it interesting enough to enjoy the reading. Fuentes' textbook is wonderful.

Great prof! Doing the readings makes the review sheets/exams easier, but not necessary. Class participation is a must. Fairly simple class as long as you keep up with the work and study. Review sheets really helpful. She will read a draft of your papers, but will literally ravage the grammar, even if you're really good at writing. Visit her office!

To be honest, as long as you know everything on the review sheet you could get away with doing NONE of the assigned reading and get an A on the exams.  Cummulative final, which sucks, but there's a review sheet on that too. Expects that you have a lot of prior history background.
Mistake prone while oblivious

Tests are somewhat easy because of review sheets given but essays are graded on grammar more than content even though it is not a grammar class. Doesn't listen to questions in class so gives useless answers. Speeds through needed info but talks for 20 minutes on something that is not on the test. DO NOT TAKE IN SUMMER!

She is a very nice person but not a very good teacher. She is always frantic and in a hurry and speeds through everything. Even if you correct all of the errors on your first essay draft, she will take points off your final for new ones. Do not take a power lecture, it is impossible to pay attention for that long.

Lovely woman. Very passionate about her teaching and making the material accessible to her students. For exams, study the quizzes and review sheets she gives you; they're very similar. Essays are fairly graded, but be sure to revise them many times before turning them in. I would definitely take another class from her.

Really wonderful teacher. She's really enthusiastic and tries to get everybody involved. I thought the paper criteria were a bit vague, but she's extremely helpful in clarifying anything you have questions on. Highly recommended.
Very, very sweet.  Tries to keep even boring things engaging.

Amazing professor, great attitude, funny, tries hard to keep students interested. Native English speaker, so she has no problem breaking into English during class to clarify things. VERY helpful, gives great reviews so tests are very straight-forward. Highly recommended!!!
Easy to understand (despite accent).  Very clear.  Fair grader.  Exams are easy to prepare for.  Funny.  Would take another one of her classes.
Great teacher.  Tests are easy since you review everything on them the class before the test.  Grades fairly.  Hard to read handwriting.
Professor Corfis is a great professor who effectively engages students in the material.

Has annoying Castillian accent, likes to babble about useless poetry crap, but does teach relevant subjects, grades fairly, and does help prepare for exams.  If you can, go for Juan Egea-he's way better.
